intro: Hieracium tauschii subsp. euumbelliferum, commonly known as the European spear-thistle, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 60–120 cm, featuring a robust stem and spiny, lobed leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a spherical or conical shape, forming a distinctive umbellate inflorescence. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
